content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-260-11-A |Item_parent=Hematuria |Item_parent_short=Hematuria |Rank=A |Title=Knowing the diagnostic tree for haematuria |Description=Figure |Rubric=Positive diagnosis |Contributors=Charles Dariane, Bruno Moulin |Order=11}} [[File:Figure 6 diagnostic tree.png|thumbnail|1050x1050px| '''Figure 6. Diagnostic tree for haematuria'''|alt=|neant]]

question.title: What is the primary cause of hematuria?

option_a.title: Urothelial carcinoma
option_a.description: A type of cancer that affects the lining of the urinary system

option_b.title: Kidney stones
option_b.description: Hard, mineralized deposits that form in the kidneys or urinary tract

option_c.title: Bladder cancer
option_c.description: A type of cancer that affects the bladder lining

option_d.title: Urinary tract infection
option_d.description: An infection that affects the urinary system
